publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3280 Aileen Campbell: Congratulations to Lanarkshire’s Calzeat and Co on Re-decorating the White House—That the Parliament congratulates Lanarkshire-based textile firm Calzeat and Co Ltd on providing fabrics for President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama’s new-look White House; notes that this family-owned business started in 1971 and that in its 39-year history it has produced fabrics for a number of prestige clients, including the Bush Senior White House, Buckingham Palace, the Dorchester Hotel, London, and Waldorf Astoria Hotel, New York, and recognises the hard work and dedication of the company to produce high-quality textiles and the prestige that this brings not only to Calzeat but to Scotland. Supported by: Bashir Ahmad*, Jamie Hepburn*, Rob Gibson*, Alasdair Allan*, Michael Matheson*, Bob Doris*, Bill Kidd*, Robin Harper*

S3M-3280 Aileen Campbell: Congratulations to Lanarkshire’s Calzeat and Co on Re-decorating the White House—That the Parliament congratulates Lanarkshire-based textile firm Calzeat and Co Ltd on providing fabrics for President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama’s new-look White House; notes that this family-owned business started in 1971 and that in its 39-year history it has produced fabrics for a number of prestige clients, including the Bush Senior White House, Buckingham Palace, the Dorchester Hotel, London, and Waldorf Astoria Hotel, New York, and recognises the hard work and dedication of the company to produce high-quality textiles and the prestige that this brings not only to Calzeat but to Scotland. Supported by: Bashir Ahmad, Jamie Hepburn, Rob Gibson, Alasdair Allan, Michael Matheson, Bob Doris, Bill Kidd, Robin Harper, Angela Constance*, Christina McKelvie*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-3280 Congratulations to Lanarkshire’s Calzeat and Co on Re-decorating the White House (lodged on 22 January 2009) Keith Brown*
S3M-3280 Congratulations to Lanarkshire’s Calzeat and Co on Re-decorating the White House (lodged on 22 January 2009) Jack McConnell*
